column6: Employee training on human rights policies or procedures
column13: Goodman established a modern slavery working group, a cross-functional and multi-jurisdictional group including representatives from the business units of procurement, legal and compliance, risk and sustainability who are responsible for the development and implementation of policies, practices and reporting on modern slavery across Goodman's operations and supply chain. The modern slavery working group is overseen by an Executive Steering Group that oversees strategy and initiatives.
column20: Modern slavery working group, supply chain, modern slavery

column6: Employee training on human rights policies or procedures
column13: Goodman created training packs for its regional teams to be rolled out face-to-face or virtually that covered topics such as identifying signs of modern slavery and providing guidance on appropriate actions to take if a modern slavery incident arises. The training sessions are designed to be interactive and engaging, ensuring that Goodman's people are well-prepared to understand the risks and address any potential modern slavery concerns that may arise during their work.
column20: Modern slavery training pack, modern slavery incident, modern slavery concern

column6: Employee training on human rights policies or procedures
column13: Goodman delivered tailored training on sustainable and social procurement, specifically addressing modern slavery, to its offshore Shared Services Team in the Philippines, which provides outsourced operational and administrative services and is located in a high-risk country. The training included specific real-life cases highlighting instances of modern slavery within their country.
column20: Sustainable and social procurement, Shared Services Team, high-risk country

column6: Employee training on human rights policies or procedures
column13: Goodman integrated an online modern slavery training module into its contractor induction app, SinePro. Goodman has made it mandatory for contractors to utilise the SinePro app each time they visit a Goodman property. When contractors sign in using the app, they must review the factsheet and complete the online module.
column20: SinePro, online module, modern slavery training

column6: Employee training on human rights policies or procedures
column13: In the UK, Goodman engaged Unseen, a leading UK anti-slavery charity. Unseen provides safehouses and support for survivors of trafficking and modern slavery and runs the UK's Modern Slavery and Exploitation Helpline.
column20: Unseen, anti-slavery charity, Modern Slavery and Exploitation Helpline

column6: Significant investment agreements and contracts that include human rights clauses or that underwent human rights screening
Significant investment agreements and contracts that include human rights clauses or that underwent human rights screening
column13: Goodman created global standards concerning human rights, modern slavery and labour protection to guide all regions concerning operational matters and supplier expectations. Goodman's standards include its remediation pathway and a step-by-step approach to managing grievances and whistleblowing, providing clear channels for reporting concerns.
column20: Global standards, human rights, modern slavery

column6: Significant investment agreements and contracts that include human rights clauses or that underwent human rights screening
column13: In Brazil, Goodman engaged third-party consultants (currently HR Assessoria e Projetos) to conduct specialised labour inspections to review site-based general contractors and subcontractors for compliance with labour and safety regulations. These inspections focus on health and safety conditions at development sites, worker accommodation, labour conditions and safety standards at Goodman's properties.
column20: Labour inspection, third-party consultant, worker accommodation

column6: Significant investment agreements and contracts that include human rights clauses or that underwent human rights screening
column13: Goodman developed the Sustainable Sourcing Framework to offer strategic guidance in accomplishing Goodman's global sourcing and supply chain objectives. This framework aims to safeguard human rights throughout Goodman's supply chain, minimise the risk of modern slavery, and help support the goals of Goodman's 2030 Sustainability Strategy.
column20: Sustainable Sourcing Framework, strategic guidance, human right

column6: Significant investment agreements and contracts that include human rights clauses or that underwent human rights screening
column13: In FY23, Goodman took steps towards expanding its procurement policies to align with the recently established Sustainable Sourcing Framework to consider environmental, social, and governance objectives within its procurement processes. By incorporating these objectives into its Supplier Code of Conduct, Goodman aims to prioritise and normalise sustainability, social responsibility, and ethical practices throughout its procurement activities.
column20: Supplier Code of Conduct, Sustainable Sourcing Framework, procurement process

column6: Significant investment agreements and contracts that include human rights clauses or that underwent human rights screening
column13: In FY23, Goodman reviewed all contract templates and precedents to confirm they included references to its Statement of Business Ethics. This statement serves as Goodman's supplier code of conduct, which outlines Goodman's expectations regarding modern slavery and human rights, amongst other matters. It is a guiding document that governs Goodman's dedication to conducting business ethically.
column20: Statement of Business Ethics, contract template, human rights

column6: Significant investment agreements and contracts that include human rights clauses or that underwent human rights screening
column13: Goodman engages in various tendering opportunities, necessitating suppliers to undergo a prequalification process. Goodman utilises supplier self-assessment questionnaires or declarations to identify potential red flags or consider ratings from external accreditation agencies. The questionnaires aim to enhance control measures in moderate to high-risk sectors.
column20: Self-assessment questionnaire, prequalification process, supplier

column6: Significant investment agreements and contracts that include human rights clauses or that underwent human rights screening
column13: As part of its commitment to prioritise the well-being and safety of the workers in its supply chain, Goodman developed a comprehensive worker accommodation guide. This guide is a valuable resource for Goodman's general contractors, providing clear expectations and standards regarding worker accommodation on site.
column20: Worker accommodation guide, well-being, safety

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: Goodman's Reconciliation Action Plan (RAP) vision seeks to make space for greatness by educating and influencing its employees, customers and stakeholders on the important role First Nations communities and peoples play in Australia. Goodman is working to provide tangible and substantive benefits for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples through its community and business activities as it moves along the path of the RAP.
column20: Reconciliation Action Plan, stakeholder, First Nations community

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: Goodman employed a Head of First Nations Engagement to lead its strategy and introduced a sustainable sourcing framework supporting First Nations employment and businesses. Goodman also introduced cultural protocols and cultural immersion opportunities for its people. It explores incorporating Country and First Nations design principles into its property portfolio.
column20: Head of First Nations Engagement, sustainable sourcing framework, cultural immersion

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: The Goodman Foundation brings together its people, properties and resources to address disadvantages in the world and make a tangible and sustainable difference. Goodman partners with like-minded organisations and funds projects with clearly defined outcomes to provide support where and when needed. Goodman is proud of how enthusiastically its people engage with the Foundation's partners worldwide.
column20: Goodman Foundation, sustainable difference, support

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: The Goodman Foundation provided much-needed support to organisations responding to natural disasters worldwide. When a massive earthquake hit TÃÂ¼rkiye in February 2023, the Foundation supported Universitair Ziekenhuis Brussel (UZ Brussel) to purchase medical equipment, medication and other relief supplies for earthquake victims.
column20: Universitair Ziekenhuis Brussel, natural disaster, medical equipment

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: In New Zealand, Cyclone Gabrielle's impacts and Auckland's flooding saw the Goodman Foundation provide additional funding for the food rescue organisation KiwiHarvest, mobile laundry and shower service Orange Sky, and the Red Cross. In Australia, the funding has contributed to Good360 distributing over 1.8 million requested items to flood-affected communities with a total retail value of $17.8 million.
column20: Cyclone Gabrielle, Auckland's flooding, Orange Sky

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: The state-of-the-art helicopter, previously donated by the Foundation to the NSW Rural Fire Service, has assisted with rescue and recovery efforts for flooding, bushfires and other inclement weather events around the State. The helicopter also assisted police in searching for missing people and is a pivotal part of firefighting training for bushfire season.
column20: NSW Rural Fire Service, helicopter, recovery effort

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: In Australia, the school attendance rate of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander children is 14 per cent lower than non-Indigenous students and as low as 63 per cent, on average, in remote areas. The Goodman Foundation partnered with the Clontarf Foundation to help close this gap and create multi-generational change, supporting at-risk First Nations boys to attend school, finish Year 12 and enter employment.
column20: Clontarf Foundation, multi-generational change, First Nation boy

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: This year, the Goodman Foundation increased its sponsorship for Shanghai Sunrise from 20 to 30 disadvantaged students, making it one of the charity's larger contributors. Goodman's Shanghai team embraces Shanghai Sunrise's education programs by hosting webinars, holding career days and mentoring students. These connections help students understand real-life job opportunities and feel more prepared to enter an otherwise intimidating workforce.
column20: Shanghai Sunrise, disadvantaged student, webinar

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: In New Zealand, Goodman's partnership with Keystone Trust continues to help students held back by inequality to get a tertiary education and begin property or construction careers. Keystone Trust awarded 12 scholarships in 2022, raising the current number of students to more than 50. One former Keystone Trust graduate, Alex Smith, was the top student in her Bachelor of Construction degree. She has continued her career progress after joining Goodman as a Project Manager last year.
column20: Keystone Trust, tertiary education, construction career

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: The Goodman Foundation funds YouthStart Belgium to support young people where school and home have failed to bring them crucial self-belief. It offers eight-day entrepreneurship programs for people aged between 16 and 30 years, during which they discover their talents, refresh their digital skills, learn how to present themselves, develop their projects and think about the future they want.
column20: YouthStart Belgium, self-belief, entrepreneurship program

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: Since 2021, Goodman's Brazil team has focussed its Foundation work on the Goodman Mais program in response to the high numbers of Brazilians that leave school to earn income for their families. The first cohort of young adults from disadvantaged areas of SÃÂ£o Paulo will graduate in late 2023 in this skills and confidence-building program. The next cohort of 30 students from around 200 applications has been selected, evidence that the Mais program is attracting young, motivated people. Each student meets bi-monthly with a Goodman mentor, and around half of Goodman's Brazil employees are taking part.
column20: Goodman Mais, confidence-building program, student

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: Violence against women and children is a serious global social and public health problem. The Goodman Foundation is investing heavily to lead prevention efforts in Australia by co-founding the Our Watch Institute to create a national movement to effect change led by Australian businesses. The Foundation also works with organisations in Australia and the US to meet the immediate needs of women escaping violent situations with essential support such as shelter, financial assistance, clothing, psychosocial counselling and education for their children.
column20: Our Watch Institute, violence, public health problem

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: Goodman partnered with Black Dog Institute to develop a unique evidence-based digital therapy for young people experiencing depression. This year, Goodman also embarked on work to co-design a program with healthcare professionals to combine person-to-person therapy with the ClearlyMeÃÂ® intervention. For the Raise Foundation, Goodman increased its funding to support more than 800 young Australians participating in their high school mentoring program, prioritising younger students at the most risk of disengagement or poor mental health and well-being.
column20: Black Dog Institute, digital therapy, depression

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: The Goodman Foundation is a key partner supporting the launch of Thread Together's new wardrobe and capsule service, placing 100 wardrobes of new clothes and sleepwear into women's refuges nationwide. Goodman people regularly volunteer to sort clothes in readiness before distribution to people in need through a national network of charities and social service agencies.
column20: Thread Together, capsule service, sleepwear
